properties.areaDesc: Waupaca, WI; Shawano, WI; Outagamie, WI
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 5 at 8:24AM CST until January 9 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in
Wisconsin...

Wolf River near Shiocton affecting Shawano, Outagamie and Waupaca
Counties.

.The combination of recent rainfall and snowmelt has caused the Wolf
River to crest above flood stage at Shiocton.

For the Lower Wolf River...including Shiocton, minor flooding is
forecast

The Flood Warning continues for
the Wolf River near Shiocton.
* Until Thursday afternoon.
* At 8:03 AM CST Sunday the stage was 11.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending
at 8:03 AM CST Sunday was 11.9 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
Wednesday morning and continue falling to 10.0 feet Sunday morning.
* Impact...At 12.0 feet, Flooding is confined to lowland and
agricultural land. The entire boat landing in Shiocton is under
several feet of floodwaters. Water is surrounding lowland areas
around homes on Mill and Island Streets.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.8
feet on 05/01/2011.
properties.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive
cars through flooded areas.

Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

The next statement will be issued this evening by 830 PM CST.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning is now in effect until early Thursday afternoon
